intro: Consolida camptocarpa, commonly known as the spurred carnation or garden helleborine, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits called silique, which contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Consolida camptocarpa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine.
